data.question: What is the chemical composition of ZIF-4?
data.answer: Zn(imidazolate)2

data.question: At what temperature and under what vacuum conditions was ZIF-4 desolvated?
data.answer: 150 °C and 10-3 mbar

data.question: What pressure-transmitting medium was used in the high-pressure experiment?
data.answer: Silicone oil (AP100)

data.question: What is the space group of ZIF-4?
data.answer: Pbca

data.question: What is the relationship between ZIF-4 and ZIF-4-LT in terms of structure?
data.answer: ZIF-4-LT occurs when ZIF-4 is cooled below -130 °C, sharing approximately the same unit cell dimensions and space group.

data.question: Is ZIF-4 stable up to 250 °C?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: Does the transition from ZIF-4 to ZIF-4-cp-II involve breaking of chemical bonds?
data.answer: No, it is a displacive transition involving the rotation of the imidazolate linkers.

data.question: What is the bulk modulus of ZIF-hPT-II?
Can ZIF-4 undergo a phase transition to a denser phase at 0.03 GPa?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the main difference between ZIF-4 and ZIF-4-cp-II?
data.answer: The main difference lies in the orientation of the imidazolate linkers.

data.question: Is ZIF-4-cp-III's structure reliably determined?
data.answer: No, due to poor data quality.

data.question: What is the topology of ZIF-hPT-II?
data.answer: Double-interpenetrated diamondoid network

data.question: Does the presence of bIm ligands in ZIF-62 inhibit the recrystallization mechanism observed in ZIF-4?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the effect of crystallite size on the thermodynamic landscape of phase transitions?
data.answer: Crystallite size can significantly affect the thermodynamic landscape, especially when reduced to nanometer scales.

data.question: Are ZIF-4 and ZIF-62 structurally similar?
data.answer: No, they substantially differ in their high-temperature behavior and phase transitions.

data.question: What is the role of kinetic control in the phase transitions of ZIF-4?
data.answer: Kinetic control can extend the apparent stability of some phases or prevent the formation of certain phases.

data.question: Is ZIF-4-cp-II energetically more stable than ZIF-4?
data.answer: No, ZIF-4-cp-II is intermediate in energy between ZIF-4 and ZIF-zni despite being the densest structure.

data.question: What is the significance of the negative Clapeyron slope in the ZIF-4–a-ZIF-4 transformation?
data.answer: It implies increasing relative densities in the order ZIF-4 < a-ZIF-4 < ZIF-4-cp-II.

data.question: Can ZIF-4 undergo amorphization above 250 °C at ambient pressure?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the effect of pressure-transmitting media on the onset pressures of amorphization?
data.answer: Different types of nonpenetrating pressure-transmitting media can affect the onset pressures of amorphization.
